p: The concept of the development of a functional food may involve the integration of health-promoting substances into a multifunctional ingredient, which could be used to design a wide range of novel food products [ 173, 174, 175]. Tagetes spp. present compounds such as flavonoids and carotenoids that are not part of the EOs but have several functions as biologically active compounds. For example, Tagetes spp. flavonoids were recognized as antiallergic, antiinflammatory, antiviral, antiproliferative, and anticarcinogenic substances. Infusions, tinctures, and juice from aerial parts of Tagetes spp. are used as traditional food additives worldwide. In turn, T. terniflora is a native plant known as “suico-suico” or “quichia”, widely used in Argentina as a condiment in soups [ 158, 176]. T. minuta can be used in hot or cold refreshing beverages.
